question.text: Which of these statements regarding modified roots and stem is incorrect?

options.text: In Asparagus, adventitious root is modified for food storage
Prop roots are for mechanical support
Underground stems of potato, ginger, turmeric, zaminkand and colocasia are modified for photosynthesis
Onion is an example of modified shoot

solution.text: Asparagus has fasciculated roots that arise in a bunch from a lower node of the stem and become fleshy for the storage of food. It is a type of modified adventitious root. Underground stems of potato (tuber), ginger and turmeric (rhizome), zaminkand and colocasia (corm) are used for food storage and vegetative propagation. Onion is a modified underground stem called the bulb. This stem is reduced and has a disc-like structure and surrounds with numerous fleshly scaly leaves.
